com.oracle.tools.runtime
Interface Application<A>

Type Parameters:
A - the concrete type of Application

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

All Known Subinterfaces:
JavaApplication<A>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractApplication, AbstractJavaApplication, SimpleApplication, SimpleJavaApplication
public interface Application<A>

An Application provides a mechanism to represent, access and control an executing application process, typically managed by an operating system.

Author:
Brian Oliver

Nested Class Summary
static class Application.EventKind
          The Application Application.EventKinds.

Method Detail

getEnvironmentVariables

Properties getEnvironmentVariables()
Obtains the environment variables that were supplied to the Application when it was realized.

Returns:
Properties of containing name value pairs, each one representing an environment variable provided to the Application when it was realized

getName

String getName()
Obtains the name of the Application.

Returns:
The name of the Application

destroy

int destroy()
Terminates and destroys the running Application. Upon returning from this method you can safely assume the Application is no longer running.

Returns:
the exit value of the Application (by convention 0 indicates normal termination)

waitFor

int waitFor()
            throws InterruptedException
Causes the calling Thread to block and wait until the Application has terminated, either naturally or due to a call to destroy() by another Thread.

This method returns immediately if the Application has already been terminated.

Returns:
the exit value of the Application (by convention 0 indicates normal termination)
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the calling Thread is interrupted by another thread while it is waiting.

exitValue

int exitValue()
Obtains the exit value for the terminated Application.

Returns:
the exit value of the Application
Throws:
IllegalThreadStateException - if the Application has not yet terminated

getPid

long getPid()
Obtain the operating system process id for the Application.

Returns:
The process id or -1 if it can't be determined.

getDefaultTimeout

long getDefaultTimeout()
Obtains the default duration to used by the Application for timeout values that have not been specified.

Returns:
the timeout duration (measured in #getTimeoutUnits())

getDefaultTimeoutUnits

TimeUnit getDefaultTimeoutUnits()
Obtains the default duration timeout TimeUnit.

Returns:
the TimeUnit for default Application timeouts

getLifecycleInterceptors

Iterable<LifecycleEventInterceptor<A>> getLifecycleInterceptors()
Obtains the LifecycleEventInterceptors for the Application.

Returns:
the LifecycleEventInterceptors
